sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Millions of Ukrainians freeze in the darkness as Russian strikes take out 50% of the country's energy infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Climate change negotiators given an extra day to thrash out a deal on global warming measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Qatar bans the sale of alcoholic drinks at its football stadiums, just days before the FIFA World Cup gets underway.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine shudders as the first snows of the harshest of winters fall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Massive Russian shelling has knocked out almost half of the country's energy infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kiev has asked Europe for additional support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The situation for millions is dire. Ukraine's prime minister said, unfortunately, Russia continues to launch missile strikes on Ukraine's civilian infrastructure, waging war against the civilian population and depriving them of light, water, heat and communications.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Kherson, newly liberated but struggling for basic goods and critical services the mood is tense residents here are crowding for government aid they are free but the russians have left a bitter taste despite the suffering of civil society the ukrainian army seems stronger than ever after reclaiming herson it has the Crimean Peninsula in its sights.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Local authorities have confirmed that Russia is fortifying positions in the territory that it annexed in 2014.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For months it was believed to be untouchable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And in the east, Moscow tries to take the city of Bakhmut to cement its hold on the Donbass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Winter is fast approaching and with it a likely slowdown in military activities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Before that, both sides are eager to gain whatever advantage they can.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: COP27 is giving itself one last chance to avoid the abyss of a planetary failure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One more day to unblock the financing by rich countries of the Climate Damage Reparation Fund demanded by developing countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A promise of $100 billion a year that has not materialized.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Dear friends, I remain committed to bringing this conference to a close tomorrow in an orderly manner, with the adoption of a series of consensus decisions that will be comprehensive, ambitious and balanced.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In a last-minute effort, the EU has accepted the principle of the reparation fund on condition that it serves the most vulnerable countries and that countries such as China contribute.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I have to say this is our final offer. This is where the member states can find an agreement and I have to thank all of them for the courage to go this far, but this is it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Frantic behind the scenes negotiations mark the extension of a climate summit with many loose threads and whose most ambitious objective is to limit global warming to 1.5 degrees above pre-industrial levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Unveiled with a great fanfare three years ago, the project to build the new European fighter aircraft never got off the ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Germany, France and Spain have now announced they will move on to the next phase of the new generation fighter plan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: With a total cost of 100 billion euros, it's Europe's biggest defence project.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: project. With the opening game of this year's World Cup just days away, Qatar has banned the sale

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: of beer and other alcoholic drinks at its football stadiums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's a major U-turn at the 11th hour on an agreement with FIFA that fans would be allowed to drink during matches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Now fans will only be able to purchase non-alcoholic beverages at the eight venues hosting games.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Supporters will still be free to enjoy the atmosphere with a beer in hand at fan zones and other special hospitality areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But many visitors will likely still be disappointed by the sudden change of heart from Qatari authorities.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: FIFA says it agreed to the last-minute ban after discussions with the hosts.
